page.title: 20CLUBS
page.content: There are no clubs or associations in the Torringtons themselves. The Methodist Chapel schoolroom is used as a social centre, where occasional whist drives are held, or children's parties when there are sufficient children in the village. A group is currently working to save West Torrington church from redundancy, but much of the impetus for this has come from elsewhere, West Torrington being inclined to Methodism, if anything. The information on this disc was collected by members of{East Barkwith {and District Women's Institute}which meets in a village adjoining East and West Torrington, but which, at the moment, does not include any members from either of these villages.
